conclusion: Determine net work done by gas over cyclic process A → B → C → A.
Pressure is constant at 1 × 10^5 Pa from A to B; volume changes from 2 L to 4 L.
Calculate work done in process A → B using W = P ΔV; W_AB = 2 × 10^5 J.
Gas undergoes linear relationship between P and V from B to C.
Calculate change in pressure ΔP = -1 × 10^5 Pa and change in volume ΔV = 1 L.
Calculate work done in process B → C; W = 2 × 10^5 Pa × 1 L = 2 × 10^5 J.
Volume decreases from 5 L to 2 L with constant pressure of 1 × 10^5 Pa from C to A.
Calculate work done in process C → A; W_CA = 3 × 10^5 J.
Calculate net work done W_net = W_AB + W_BC + W_CA = 3 × 10^5 J.
Net work done by gas on surroundings is 3 × 10^5 J.
